results.title: Making books
results.brief_description: The story of the mass production of books in the USA, showing the ingenuity and technology used at the Country Life Press, Garden City, New York. The film follows every process from the author’s manuscript to the finished book on the bookstall stand.

results.title: Making biscuit
results.brief_description: Making Biscuit shows life in a biscuit factory through the eyes and experiences of women employed in the blue collar industry. Four ex-employees of a biscuit making company were directly involved in making this film which was animated from over 2,000 slides.

results.title: Making baskets: an art adventure
results.creator_credit: Bill Mackie and Easy Street Productions
results.brief_description: Shows a young woman and three elmentary grade students making baskets from a variety of materials including leaves, pine needles, rope and yarn. Demonstrates in detail each step of cording, wrapping, coiling and stitching. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Making a Start in Oriental Brush Painting
results.brief_description: An introduction to this beautiful and absorbing art form. Kit Nicol, a talented watercolour artist shows the influence of her long interest in oriental art and culture and that the language of painting is universal. The various sections cover: starting to work, sitting position, brushstrokes, mastering of techniques, painting two subjects (roses and poppies) in full colour, and mounting and framing. Rated: G

results.title: Making a pack basket
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: Pop Williams, an old-timer, demonstrates techniques for making a pack basket. He begins with the actual cutting down of an ash tree, stripping it out, and step by step, pounding out the weaving strips, weaving, attaching rims, handles and shoulder straps.

results.title: Making a decision is...
results.brief_description: Examines the decision-making skill in the making of decisions varying from trivial to life’s choices. Explores key considerations in helping to arrive at decisions. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Making a decision in the family
results.creator_credit: Julia Murphy, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Discussion film for adults on parental authority and teenagers. When a high-school girl declares her preference for going to a gathering of her own friends rather than to a family gathering, she runs headlong into her parent’s objections. It is their decision and not hers which is to abide. The result is a clash of wills. The question of what might have been a better approach is left with the film audience.

results.title: Making a car bumper
results.creator_credit: Topical Film Company and Brent Productions
results.brief_description: The making of a steel bumper by a machine press is used to illustrate the skill of the makers of press tools, the punch and the die, by means of which quantities of bumpers can be produced with a minimum of skilled labour. A vocational guidance film showing the skilled work of the tool maker in large-scale production engineering.
